description:
AFRO HOUSE HELSINKI
‚òÖ Afro House ‚òÖ Kuduro ‚òÖ Gqom ‚òÖ Soulful House ‚òÖ

Finally we have a club night dedicated to soulful Afro House and energetic beats of Kuduro and Gqom. Resident djs Soul Sanna & DJ Hermanni and their special guests from all over the world give you the hottest and deepest sounds available.

SOUL SANNA is a musiclover, dj and dancer. She has rocked the dance floor in different club and dance events in Finland. Sanna is best known as member of Cleva dance collective as well as a Dj on the Bridge show on Bassoradio. For the past years her sets have graced  for example Nordic Soul Festival, Afro Sunday, Abyss The House Dance Experience, Payback Jam, Urban Apa as well as several art exhibitions and pop up events. She deejayed also internationally in Sweden, Denmark and Italy. 

DJ HERMANNI is known from the biggest Afrobeats club in Finland, Afro Sunday, The biggest Latin music party in Finland, Fiesta Latina and presenting the hottest club music from all over the world @Boom Shakalaka Show @ Bassoradio among many other things. He has rocked the parties from Akaa to Zanzibar since 1999.

DJ NELOKUATA is our very first special guest. He is a Kuduro and Afro House specialist originating from the roots of Kuduro, Angola and he is currently spreading the culture from Tampere, Finland. 

ALAKULTTUURITALO is a sweaty basement with proper dancefloor, great soundsystem and moody lights dedicated to electronic underground of Helsinki.

Your instructors :

Prices:

(‚óï‚Äø‚óï‚úø)Fullpass for both days 69 euros

(‚úø‚ó†‚Äø‚ó†) Day pass 45 euros
Urban kiz or Tarrafuzz block 45 euros

(‚ó°‚Äø‚ó°‚úø)Single workshop 25 euros

Workshops Saturday:
Tarrafuzz part I from 11 - 12.30
Urban kiz 12.45 - 14.15

Workshops Sunday:
Urban kiz from 11 - 12.30
Tarrafuzz part II from 12.45 - 14.15



Biography

Lucien Noten grew up in the Caribbean. Being influenced with Caribbean music all his life, he finally made the switch to Latin. After trying Salsa he fell in love with Dominican Bachata. Doing this for several years and teaching it, friends persuade him to try Kizomba. Also because kizomba was getting more and more popular and bachata was played less on parties.

He took lessons from great teachers as:Albir, Laurent, Enah, Felicien and Kwenda Lima. He decided that after those lessons it was time to develop his own style. He started dancing and mixing the different styles. As a teenager he had learned to play drums. With this experience he started experimented when dancing with ladies to see if they could follow him while he was playing the music on their back.

This resulted in his own Urban Tarraxa style he now calls ‚ÄúTarrafuzz‚Äù. The name is chosen not to disrespect the original kizomba and or Tarraxhina.

He met his current dance partner Maryama Camara in 2016. And together they made a curriculum to teach this new style.

This style is based on body isolations of the upper and lower body. Where the leader uses the upper body of the follower as an instrument to play the beat he or she hears in the music. The result is a fast rhythmic moving of the upper and lower body.

name: AfroLatin Nights - Every Monday!
description:
Helsinki afrolatin dance scene united every Monday! :) Salsa, bachata, kizomba, semba, zouk - we got you covered! If you haven't been at AfroLatin Nights before, come and get hooked!  

Zoukers will kick off the evening at 6.30pm! Come and enjoy! 
From 9.30pm onwards we'll have two dance floors: one for Salsa & Bachata and one for Kizomba and Semba! 

Join us at India House! They also have amazing food, so if you fancy eating something after your classes and before dancing make sure you try something. Kitchen closes around 21:45. Remember that this is a bar venue and you are not allowed to consume your own drinks on the premises. Please respect this as we want to keep the venue happy and we want to be able to continue to host these kind of events.
Entrance is through Forum's Simonkatu entrance. Don't go from Yrj√∂nkatu as that side will be closed!

name: Sabor Social presents: Salsa Fridays
description:
Baila con Sabor! 

Sabor Social perjantai on taas t√§√§ll√§! 

Sabor Social Friday is back!
------------------------------------------------
Salsa Borealis is again offering dance teaching on Fridays! The events start at 6pm and last for two hours. The structure of each class depends on the teacher and style of the day. The new concept allows for any Latin dances (or related styles), depending on the demand and availability of teachers. Sabor Social Fridays are free for all Sabor members, and memberships will also be sold at the beginning of each class (20e per calendar year) - be sure to come early if you need to buy a membership card or claim a prepaid card.
------------------------------------------------
We'll start the 2018 season with some On2 salsa classes! Jharyis Boitel, who was teaching 3 times in the autumn, is back, now partnering with Outi Herkepeus! You might have been to their classes in different dance schools, where they have been teaching. Now Jharyis and Outi have joined forces, and are teaching On2 salsa together under the DanceLovers brand. Read more about their new courses here: https://www.dancelovers.fi/

The classes at Sabor Social will be On2 salsa, contain both solo and partner dancing, beginner/open level. Teaching will be in English, with Finnish translation as needed. 

Class description:
We will do a 15-minute warm-up and after that an intensive and fun solo class. We will learn some new shines, focusing on dancing with the music and improving your style of dancing. The pace of the solo class will increase towards the end so we will sweat!

The second half of the class will be partnerwork, where we will learn a routine you can immediately use on the dance floor. We will also give tips and tricks on leading and following, and creating a great connection with your dance partner!

Where: Skills Gym, Salmisaaren liikuntakeskus, Energiakatu 3, 4th floor https://www.skillzgym.fi/
When: Friday 2.2. at 18-20 - All 4 times for Jharyis & Outi's classes at Sabor Social are 12.1., 19.1., 2.2. and 9.2.
What: Solo and partner work in On2 salsa with the DanceLovers team.
------------------------------------------------
Teachers wanted! Are you a dance teacher (professional or aspiring)? Do you want to support the Latin dance community in the Helsinki region? Sabor Social Fridays can only continue if we get teachers to participate. Contact the Salsa Borealis board members via Facebook or directly!

#bailaconsabor #salsaborealis

name: Dance Heaven - More Details Soon
description:
Join every first Saturday of the month for Dance Heaven!
Pre-party Class & DJ Line-up will be published closer to the date.

What is Dance Heaven?
A one of a kind concept, taking place the first Saturday of the month, uniting afrolatin dancers from different dance schools and regions to dance non-stop, yes non-stop if you want with a room for each style so you can dance non-stop! Yes that's 5 rooms! Cuban Salsa, Cross Body Salsa, Kizomba, Zouk & Bachata! 
You're a Salsa dancer? Yes, no breaks for Bachata or Kizomba!
You're a Kizomba dancer? Yes again, no breaks for other dance styles!
You can dance your style all night long! Aaaaaah okay so you are an allround dancer... awesome! You can switch rooms when you feel like dancing another style! 

Awesome people, great international and local DJs and teachers.
Soft drinks and snacks included till they last, and you are free to bring your own drinks and snacks to keep you going all night!

You like the concept? Help spreading the word by inviting your friends and sharing the event! The more people, the more we dance, the more awesome the party it will be! 

If you have some favorite songs you would like to hear during the party feel free to request them as a post in this event.

Room setup:
Room 1 - Kizomba
Room 2 - Zouk
Room 3 - Cuban Salsa

description:
Omar & Johanna Spring Courses 2018

You wanna 
-learn new dance styles? 
-improve your skills and techniques? 
-get individual tips & training from patient and skillful teachers?
-have a safe and encouraging learning environment?
-find new friends? 
-have fun? 

Then you found the right place! :) 
Please read carefully all the information if you want to join our classes. 

During the Spring Season with us you‚Äôll learn Bachata, Kizomba, Kizomba Fusion, Cross body salsa & Cuban salsa. 
This season we will have 6 courses + 2 kinds of bi-weekly drop-in classes in Kizomba Fusion & Sensual Bachata.

Our main focus is that you learn, while having fun! We provide clear instruction and we focus on each and everyone‚Äôs development individually. Our training focuses on giving you the tools to become the social dancer everyone wants to dance with at the parties! 
At the courses you'll learn technique, musicality, body awareness & movement and patterns for social dancing. Join our dance classes and become part of Helsinki dance community where people come to share the joy of dance with friends & develop their passion! 

Dancing, like all best things in life, are best when shared! So what makes the dancing and courses even more exciting and fun is that all this you'll be sharing with many great people in a welcoming and warm atmosphere! :)

name: Sabor Social presents: Salsa Fridays
description:
Baila con Sabor! 

Sabor Social perjantai on taas t√§√§ll√§! 

Sabor Social Friday is back!
------------------------------------------------
Salsa Borealis is again offering dance teaching on Fridays! The events start at 6pm and last for two hours. The structure of each class depends on the teacher and style of the day. The new concept allows for any Latin dances (or related styles), depending on the demand and availability of teachers. Sabor Social Fridays are free for all Sabor members, and memberships will also be sold at the beginning of each class (20e per calendar year) - be sure to come early if you need to buy a membership card or claim a prepaid card.
------------------------------------------------
We'll start the 2018 season with some On2 salsa classes! Jharyis Boitel, who was teaching 3 times in the autumn, is back, now partnering with Outi Herkepeus! You might have been to their classes in different dance schools, where they have been teaching. Now Jharyis and Outi have joined forces, and are teaching On2 salsa together under the DanceLovers brand. Read more about their new courses here: https://www.dancelovers.fi/

The classes at Sabor Social will be On2 salsa, contain both solo and partner dancing, beginner/open level. Teaching will be in English, with Finnish translation as needed. 

Class description:
We will do a 15-minute warm-up and after that an intensive and fun solo class. We will learn some new shines, focusing on dancing with the music and improving your style of dancing. The pace of the solo class will increase towards the end so we will sweat!

The second half of the class will be partnerwork, where we will learn a routine you can immediately use on the dance floor. We will also give tips and tricks on leading and following, and creating a great connection with your dance partner!

Where: Skills Gym, Salmisaaren liikuntakeskus, Energiakatu 3, 4th floor https://www.skillzgym.fi/
When: Friday 9.2. at 18-20 - All 4 times for Jharyis & Outi's classes at Sabor Social are 12.1., 19.1., 2.2. and 9.2.
What: Solo and partner work in On2 salsa with the DanceLovers team.
------------------------------------------------
Teachers wanted! Are you a dance teacher (professional or aspiring)? Do you want to support the Latin dance community in the Helsinki region? Sabor Social Fridays can only continue if we get teachers to participate. Contact the Salsa Borealis board members via Facebook or directly!

#bailaconsabor #salsaborealis

Theodore Wolashie Awadzi aka Theo is the founder of Dance-Drive. He was the UK IDO Kizomba Champion 2012 as well as the 2012 UKA salsa champion held in Bolton.  His excellent teaching style has earned him recognition across the world. His excellent teaching style and fun workshops have resulted in extensive travel around the world, teaching at congresses and festivals. In between travels he is based in Oslo, Norway where he has established the Kizomba scene over the past year.

With roots from the West African Country of Ghana, Theo‚Äôs dancing love is not limited to Kizomba, but extends to Semba, Afro-house, Kuduro and Tarraxinha! He focuses on connection between partners, footwork, body motion and Ginga, partner work and styling.
Aside from teaching, Theo is also a sought after Kizomba DJ. 


Awards
1st Place British Open Professional Salsa Champion 2012 
1st Place Kizomba champion 2011
3rd Place British Open salsa Champion 2011
Joint 1ST British Open Salsa Showcase Champion 2010
4th Place British Open Salsa Champion 2010

#English

Kizomba Teacher Certification I&F - Level 1

### Formation in French and English -  Open to everyone, inter-advanced level required ###

Hello everyone !
We propose our second professional certification session level 1.

You are kizomba dancer since a moment and want to reach the next step, or you are dance teachers and want to improve your technique, your style and your pedagogy, you want to boost your classes and go further in your teaching, then you should like it!

Whether you dance with a modern kizomba style, urbankiz, traditional or even semba, the goal is to strengthen your technique and your pedagogy, and create or keep your own style, your personality!

Through an intensive weekend, with 8 hours a day on Saturday and Sunday, we will give you all the technical, but also pedagogical and communication keys to develop your courses as a kizomba teacher.

We will see together all the fundamentals of this dance, starting from the posture to the complete moves, going through the transmission of information between the two partners and the biomechanics of the movements.

We will talk the pedagogical aspects of your courses, how to get a message from you to your students, and how to build your program over the year.

We will also talk about the communication, giving you our keys to develop your network and increase the scope of your events.


The goal of this seminary (first level of a series of 3) is to ensure that you can give beginner / beginner+ courses, being ready for any eventuality and being able to manage easily your group of students.

ATTENTION: The places will be limited for each level (25 couples), for a better comfort of the group, and each level requires to have followed the previous seminary (to reach level 2, you must have followed and validated level 1).

At the end of the weekend, an evaluation will help you to situate yourself in relation to the group and to your knowledge, and a certificate will be given to you.

name: Kizomba First Steps - February Bootcamp
description:
Welcome to our February First steps bootcamp.

Come and take your first steps in Kizomba with us.

In this bootcamp you will get introduced to the Kizomba dance and music. Our ambition is to give you, in three hours, the sensation of what it is like to dance Kizomba. Are you ready for the challenge?

We will go through the basic steps, learning how to walk, weight transfer and balance. We will experiment with base 2, base 3, balance step, estrella and finally virgula.

After this bootcamp, if you like Kizomba and wish to continue, you will be ready to join our First Steps course.

The price for this bootcamp is 30 EUR

You can either register and sign-up on our web site: www.azembora.com/first-steps or by dropping us a mail at info@azembora.com

Bachata tanssi tulee Dominikaanisista tasavalloista. Bachata on erityisesti romanttinen paritanssi, jossa voidaan tanssia my√∂s parin kesken soolo-osuuksia. Reggaeton

Musiikkityyliss√§ sekoittuvat latinalainen musiikki, jamaikalainen reggae ja dancehall sek√§ Amerikan hip hop. Musiikki on iskev√§√§ ja kuumaa. name: Kizomba First Steps February Course
description:
A one month course put together to allow you to get the basics of the Kizomba dance. After this one month course you should have enough foundation to participate in all of Azembora's Kizomba 1 classes. 

The course runs on Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday at 18:00 during the month. You are welcome to join until the end of the first week of the course. Tatjana and Laura will be your teachers.

In February, this course has 8 scheduled hours. the price for the course is 50 EUR. It is priced in such a way that you should attempt to attend at least 5 of its classes. These hours at this rate are not transferable to other Azembora classes.

Your first visit during the first week of the course is free, you can decide after that first hour if you want to commit to it.

name: Dance Heaven - Every first Saturday!
description:
Join every first Saturday of the month for Dance Heaven!
Pre-party Class & DJ Line-up will be published closer to the date.

What is Dance Heaven?
A one of a kind concept, taking place the first Saturday of the month, uniting afrolatin dancers from different dance schools and regions to dance non-stop, yes non-stop if you want with a room for each style so you can dance non-stop! Yes that's 5 rooms! Cuban Salsa, Cross Body Salsa, Kizomba, Zouk & Bachata! 
You're a Salsa dancer? Yes, no breaks for Bachata or Kizomba!
You're a Kizomba dancer? Yes again, no breaks for other dance styles!
You can dance your style all night long! Aaaaaah okay so you are an allround dancer... awesome! You can switch rooms when you feel like dancing another style! 

Awesome people, great international and local DJs and teachers.
Soft drinks and snacks included till they last, and you are free to bring your own drinks and snacks to keep you going all night!

You like the concept? Help spreading the word by inviting your friends and sharing the event! The more people, the more we dance, the more awesome the party it will be! 

If you have some favorite songs you would like to hear during the party feel free to request them as a post in this event.

Room setup:
Room 1 - Kizomba
Room 2 - Zouk
Room 3 - Cuban Salsa
Room 4 - Cross Body Salsa
Room 5 - Bachata

Pricing: 
Prices include snacks and soft drinks! (while they last) 
You can also bring your own drinks and snacks.

Party Only 15‚Ç¨
Party & 1h Pre-party Class 20‚Ç¨
Party & 1.5h Pre-party Class with Guest Teacher 35‚Ç¨

Payment
NO CARDS
Cash or Smartum/Virike at the Door
Please take the exact amount to speed up the payment processing  and avoid queues at the door.

Venue: 
Footlight, Mannerheimintie 6, 4th floor 

‚ùóÔ∏è‚ùóÔ∏è IMPORTANT:
The entrance to the building is at the same place than the DTM club, so in case the doormen are asking you to pay for the DTM party at the door, tell them you are going to a "salsa party at Footlight". Yeah... it's not only a salsa party, but that's what the staff had told the security guys, so we stick with that. :D 
And then take the elevator to the 4th floor where we will be waiting for you. :) 

There are dressing rooms at the venue where you can leave your jackets (men's dressing room upstairs). 

Shoes will be left at the entrance in the hallway when you get out of the elevator. 
‚ùóÔ∏è‚ùóÔ∏è Remember to take your indoor dance shoes (or socks) with you - outdoor shoes are not allowed in the dance rooms! 

Please don't take any drinks outside when going for a smoke! This is not legal in Finland.

Get your party mode on! This is gonna be an awesome party! :)

name: Audi MPK Urban Kiz Special
description:
We present your instructor: Audi Mpk

Born in the states, grew up in France and the US, dancing african and carribean dances Audi quickly fell in love with Kizomba but leans more towards Urban Kiz. 
Learned from instructors such as Enah, Albir, Laurent/Adeline, Gwanny/Kizzy, Chamalo, Eddy Vents/Lucia, Tboy/Ashby, Steve/Maureen and several others, his unique musicality and dance approach has ranked Audi as one of top Urban Kiz instructors in the Kizomba world in terms of dance and p√©dagogy. He placed as well 2nd in the 2017 Olympiads of Kizomba in Paris. 

Now located in Dallas, Texas Audi's dedication to spread the knowledge and his love for Kizomba is undeniable. Participating in and creating multiple workshops across the states, Audi branded himself as Audi Mpk which stands for (Musicality Personality Kizomba). His curriculum focuses on understanding body movement, musical interpr√©tation, and adding personality to the dance from mastering the techniques of leading and following.

name: Dance Heaven - Every first Saturday!
description:
Join every first Saturday of the month for Dance Heaven!
Pre-party Class & DJ Line-up will be published closer to the date.

What is Dance Heaven?
A one of a kind concept, taking place the first Saturday of the month, uniting afrolatin dancers from different dance schools and regions to dance non-stop, yes non-stop if you want with a room for each style so you can dance non-stop! Yes that's 5 rooms! Cuban Salsa, Cross Body Salsa, Kizomba, Zouk & Bachata! 
You're a Salsa dancer? Yes, no breaks for Bachata or Kizomba!
You're a Kizomba dancer? Yes again, no breaks for other dance styles!
You can dance your style all night long! Aaaaaah okay so you are an allround dancer... awesome! You can switch rooms when you feel like dancing another style! 

Awesome people, great international and local DJs and teachers.
Soft drinks and snacks included till they last, and you are free to bring your own drinks and snacks to keep you going all night!

You like the concept? Help spreading the word by inviting your friends and sharing the event! The more people, the more we dance, the more awesome the party it will be! 

If you have some favorite songs you would like to hear during the party feel free to request them as a post in this event.

Room setup:
Room 1 - Kizomba
Room 2 - Zouk
Room 3 - Cuban Salsa
Room 4 - Cross Body Salsa
Room 5 - Bachata

Pricing: 
Prices include snacks and soft drinks! (while they last) 
You can also bring your own drinks and snacks.

Party Only 15‚Ç¨
Party & 1h Pre-party Class 20‚Ç¨
Party & 1.5h Pre-party Class with Guest Teacher 35‚Ç¨

Payment
NO CARDS
Cash or Smartum/Virike at the Door
Please take the exact amount to speed up the payment processing  and avoid queues at the door.

Venue: 
Footlight, Mannerheimintie 6, 4th floor 

‚ùóÔ∏è‚ùóÔ∏è IMPORTANT:
The entrance to the building is at the same place than the DTM club, so in case the doormen are asking you to pay for the DTM party at the door, tell them you are going to a "salsa party at Footlight". Yeah... it's not only a salsa party, but that's what the staff had told the security guys, so we stick with that. :D 
And then take the elevator to the 4th floor where we will be waiting for you. :) 

There are dressing rooms at the venue where you can leave your jackets (men's dressing room upstairs). 

Shoes will be left at the entrance in the hallway when you get out of the elevator. 
‚ùóÔ∏è‚ùóÔ∏è Remember to take your indoor dance shoes (or socks) with you - outdoor shoes are not allowed in the dance rooms! 

Please don't take any drinks outside when going for a smoke! This is not legal in Finland.

Get your party mode on! This is gonna be an awesome party! :)

name: HSA Party - 13.4.2018
description:
‚ú® HSA opens its doors again for another unforgettable Salsa Party ‚ú®

üåπ Agenda:
üö™ 18:30 - Doors Open
üíÉüèª 19:00 - Musicality Workshop

üå† 02:00 - Final dances of the evening

More details coming soon ‚ú®


*************************************************************************************
IF YOU ARE COMING FOR THE FIRST TIME, READ THIS:
*************************************************************************************
- Great salsa dance venue in Helsinki with a fantastic 120m2 wooden floor, cool party lights and great acoustic for a great atmosphere

- Make sure to leave your name and e-mail to sign-up to the party

- Step into salsa dance heaven! Playing popular in Salsa, Mambo, Cha Cha, Bachata and some surprise tunes!

- Yes, Beginners are most welcome! In fact, all levels are welcome! There is music for the beginner to the advanced dancer!

- Come by yourself OR bring a friend! Plenty of people to dance with! Also, ask us for a dance whenever you want - the organizers - we'd love to dance with you!

- ALSO: Drop-in salsa class for all levels is often held before the party!(At times also special workshop is scheduled) 

- The party and the lessons are taking place in a dance studio. Therefore, remember to leave your outdoor shoes to the lobby area. Only dance shoes, jazz shoes, socks, or indoor shoes at the dance floor.

- Bring your own water bottles or cups for drinking. Please, keep all drinks in the lobby area. Our dance floor will thank you!

*************************************************************************************
LOCATION

name: Jo√£o & Giedre Special
description:
We are very happy to announce Jo√£o & Giedre special.

We will have three hours of class on Saturday by these top level international artists.

Pricing: 
Azembora drop in 12 EUR per hour (36 EUR for the three hours).
Azembora 10 and 20 turn card turns can also be used. 
Azembora contract customers can get access to the three hours of class for 15 EUR (5 EUR per hour)

Jo√£o & Giedre teach together for 4 years. They live in Frankfurt (Germany) and own kizomba school called ‚ÄúKizomba Fabrik‚Äù, where they give weekly classes and organize parties. What is more, they give monthly classes in Stockholm (Sweden) and weekend workshops in different kizomba festivals all around the world. Together they organize 5 international kizomba events: 4 of them take place in Portugal and 1 in London (UK).
Their classes are known as very detailed and highly technical, they focus on traditional kizomba and semba, pay a lot of attention to the Angolan culture, introduce retro music to the classes, teach not only kizomba, semba, tarraxinha, but also they give classes of old school kizomba flow, leading and following techniques, musicality. They created modern class of kizomba with tango influence, which got one of their most popular classes at the moment.

Jo√£o Rocha
He was born in Lisbon, Portugal. Salsa was his 1st love, in 1999, Kizomba came into his life in 2007. Having inspirations such as Master Petchu, Kwenda Lima and Afrolatin Connection he has developed his own style!
In May 2010 he was invited to perform Semba at the prestigious ‚ÄúAfricadan√ßar‚Äù. In October 2010 he moved to London to teach and contribute to the growing Kizomba scene in the UK. In February 2012 he moved to Stockholm and created 1st Kizomba Scene there under the name of ‚ÄúKizombafeber‚Äù along with his current dancing partner Giedre Lapaite. The same year he started practicing dj-ing and was called DJ ‚ÄúRock‚Äù. In 2015 he moved to Frankfurt.
He has been teaching and performing at several events around the world in more than 30 countries including Major Countries in Europe, USA, Russia, Brasil (to name a few) and organizing his own Renowned Festival in Lisbon "LIKE Festival" since 2010, ‚ÄúToma-Toma‚Äù in Bratislava with Alvaro Gustavo since 2013 and ‚ÄúLOVE LIKE LONDON‚Äù with ‚ÄúMambo City‚Äù since 2014. His new international projects of 2016: festival in Lisbon - ‚ÄúDjs Delight‚Äù and ‚ÄúKizomba Sunrise‚Äù in Algarve.

Giedre Lapaite 
Lithuanian girl with Ballroom, LA and Cuban Salsa background. She tried her first steps of Kizomba in Vilnius, Lithuania, got very interested in dance and culture and started to travel to Portugal in order become a good Kizomba dancer. 
In 2011 she met Joao Rocha, who has given her love to Semba and invited her to teach together. In 2012 Giedre deepened her knowledge of Angola‚Äôs history and culture with Master Petchu and Vanessa. In the same year she moved to Stockholm, Sweden, started to give regular kizomba, semba classes and organize kizomba events together with Joao Rocha. In 2015 she moved to Frankfurt.
She has already taught in numerous kizomba festivals in Norway, Sweden, Finland, Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia, Poland, Belarus, Russia, Germany, Austria, Hungary, Netherlands, United Kingdom, Ireland, France, Slovakia, Czech Republic, Italy, Spain, Portugal, Canada. 
In 2013 she has joined organization team of prestigious kizomba festival in Lisbon‚Äì ‚ÄúLIKE‚Äù, in 2014 - ‚ÄúLOVE LIKE LONDON‚Äù festival in London, in 2015 - "DJ‚ÄôS Delight" and "Kizomba Sunrise", which are going to take place in 2016.

name: Samba de Gafieira Drop-ins
description:
Samba de Gafieira is back this Spring!
Here comes your weekly dose of this amazing Brazilian Social dance!!
________________________________________________________
Don't know what Samba de Gafieira is? Here is a little about it:

Samba de Gafieira (also called Gafieira) is a partner dance to the Brazilian samba musical rhythms and must be distinguished from the ballroom Samba, danced in International Latin and American Rhythm ballroom dance styles. It appeared in the 1940s and it gets its name from the Gafieira ‚Äì popular urban nightclubs of Rio de Janeiro at that time. The dance derived from the Maxixe and followed the arrival of the Choro (another samba musical style). It left most of the Maxixe‚Äôs Polka elements behind but maintained the entwined leg movements of the Argentine Tango, although adopting a more relaxed posture than the latter. Many see this form of Samba as a combination of Waltz and Tango. Several Brazilian dance studios use elements and techniques from these two dances to teach Samba de Gafieira steps and dance routines.

Gafieira is usually a pair dance, although in artistic performances it is not uncommon to add solo variations, including steps of Samba no P√©.

The word ‚ÄúGafieira‚Äù can also refer to the traditional samba music orchestra, as well as the dance hall where it is performed. The term gafieira was Brazilian Portuguese slang meaning ‚Äúlow dancing resort, gaff, honky-tonk‚Äù or ‚Äúdance festivity frequented by the populace‚Äù.

The style originated from samba dancing in cabarets and gafieiras (hence the name, literally meaning ‚ÄúSamba of gafieira‚Äù), primarily in districts of Botafogo, Catete and Centro of Rio de Janeiro. The term gained recognition in 1940s. Over time the style significantly evolved away from the style 1940s under significant influence of Argentine Tango and incorporating many acrobatic elements.‚Äù

The steps are done on a short-short-long (quick-quick-slow) tempo and the basic step motion goes as follows:
step ‚Äì replace ‚Äì forward (long)
step ‚Äì replace ‚Äì backwards (long)

From its inception to nowadays the Samba de Gafieira has incorporated many acrobatic movements and has evolved to become today‚Äôs most complex dancing style of Samba in Brazil. This style is present in dance academies worldwide.
_________________________________________________________

name: Visit Angola July 2018
description:
Spend 10 days dancing and learning in Angola in July 2018!
(Read trip info in the discussion.)

The first trip we did to Angola in July 2017 was fantastic. Next one is coming up in April. For the third trip in July 2018 YOU have a chance to join us!

We are planning a 10 day trip to Luanda and surrounding areas, with dancing, food, culture, visits to interesting places, and classes with authentic teachers. Of course, we will visit the famous Kizomba na Rua not just once, but twice! 

July is winter in Angola, so the weather will be mild and pleasant, with no rain - so no worries about exessive African heat!

The trip will begin and end Lisbon, from where we can get direct flights together to Luanda. This means you can plan your own flights to and from Lisbon, with an opportunity to spend some time in this beautiful city before and/or after your trip to Africa!

You will need a visa to travel to Angola, some vaccinations and good travel insurance. (But you don't need to get the visa for yourself ‚Äì we take care of that.) All questions regarding the visa and other details will be answered later to those who are actually joining us ‚Äì message us, if you are interested!


Best regards,
Carlos & Kirsi

name: FIKi'19 - Finland's International Kizomba Festival
description:
Oh Yeaaaaas!!! FIKi'19!

LIMITED EARLY BIRD PASSES START SELLING JANUARY 20th!
Spread the love and invite all your local and international Kizomba friends to this event!

----------------------------

FIKi'19 - The 4th edition of the krayziest winter kizomba festival in the Nordics will now be 1 week earlier! We kick off on Thursday January 3rd with the pre-party and continue till January 7th with the Hang-over party! 5 Days of awesomeness, krayziness, dancing, hugs, laughing, meeting new people, and soooo much more!

So mark your calendars!

As always:
‚úîÔ∏è Renown International Artists
‚úîÔ∏è High Quality Workshops with Int/Adv Track & Imp/Int Track
‚úîÔ∏è Dope AfroHouse & Kuduro Workshops
‚úîÔ∏è Daytime Socials
‚úîÔ∏è Awesome Parties
‚úîÔ∏è ............

More details will be published throughout the year.

Check out some of the photos from the past events at FIKi Festival Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/fikifestival/
Note that not all photos from FIKi'18 have even been published at the time of publishing this event but we can't hold back the excitement we have for FIKi'19! 

----------------------------

PASSES:
Get your pass early to get the best rates! Pass prices go up at set dates.

- Discounted international rates, separate registration link.
- Get a discounted rate by buying a couple pass where possible!
- There are Limited Early Bird Passes
- Pass Holders get a discount for the Thursday's Warm-up Party.
- Pass Holders gets a discount for pre-party workshops.
- Party Passes are only sold the last month and at the door

Pass Options
Full Pass - Includes All Workshops, Socials & Parties Fri-Sun
Dance Pass - Includes All Socials & Parties Fri-Sun
Party Pass - Includes All Parties Fri-Sun

For those interested in the AfroHouse & Kuduro Passes, there's will be a separate event for that.

For those living in Finland wondering why there is a cheaper rate for International Attendees. The costs of organising an event in Finland are a lot higher compared to costs in most other countries while at the same time the market in Finland is a lot smaller. Our aim is to keep improving you and the general level of Kizomba in Finland by getting high quality teachers to this event while at the same time making Finland attractive for International Attendees by offering them an attractive rate. We thank you for your understanding and support!


Early Bird Registration opens January 20th!
Limited Early Bird Passes!

----------------------------

REGISTRATION:
Get your pass early to get the best rates!
Early Bird Registration opens January 20th!
Limited Early Bird Passes!

Registration for international attendees:

Door ‚Äì Cash & Smartum / Virike vouchers (Door rates apply)
